tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE RemoteWorkSchedules (
    schedule_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT NOT NULL,
    work_date DATE NOT NULL,
    start_time TIME NOT NULL,
    end_time TIME NOT NULL,
    task_description TEXT,
    team_calendar_id INT
);

CREATE TABLE RemoteWorkSchedule (
    work_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    team_id INT,
    work_date DATE,
    start_time TIME,
    end_time TIME
);

CREATE TABLE schedule (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    date DATE,
    start_time TIME,
    end_time TIME,
    employee_id INT
);

CREATE TABLE event (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    event_name VARCHAR(50),
    event_date DATE,
    location VARCHAR(100),
    team_id INT
);

CREATE TABLE RemoteWorkSchedule (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    date DATE,
    employee_name VARCHAR(255),
    start_time TIME,
    end_time TIME
);

CREATE TABLE WorkShifts (
    shift_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    shift_name VARCHAR(255),
    start_time TIME,
    end_time TIME,
    assigned_employee_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (assigned_employee_id) REFERENCES TeamMembers(member_id)
);

CREATE TABLE WorkSchedules (
    schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    team_id INT,
    start_date DATE,
    end_date DATE,
    CONSTRAINT fk_team_id FOREIGN KEY (team_id) REFERENCES Teams(team_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Events (
    event_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    event_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    event_date DATE,
    team_id INT,
    CONSTRAINT fk_event_team_id FOREIGN KEY (team_id) REFERENCES Teams(team_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Calendar (
    event_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    schedule_id INT,
    event_date DATE,
    event_notes TEXT,
    CONSTRAINT fk_schedule_id FOREIGN KEY (schedule_id) REFERENCES WorkSchedules(schedule_id)
);
